page.title: 06Nutley Lodge
page.content: Nutley Lodge is a residential home housed at 43 Sherford Road, Elburton. Originally built in 1925. Mr. Woodcock bought the house from Mr. May in 1977 and converted it into a residential home in 1984. He started it because (I) there was not a good residential home in the area{(II)}the house was suited for the purpose{(III)}it was something that he always wanted to do. An extension has just been built increasing the number of rooms for the elderly to eighteen. The house has to be at a temperature of at least 70 degrees Celsius. There are 12 elderly people living in the house at present. The rooms are equipped to safety standards. The average age for the ladies is 85 with the oldest being 92 years old. We came to the conclusion that they like it very much at Nutley Lodge.
